result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $2,400.00 plus all costs, penalties, surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge. To be collected by DOC out of up to 25% of prison wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse program after serving one half (1/2) Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. **10/20/2015  credit amended to 253 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
No illegal drugs. No  controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.  No contact with Coley J. victim in 13CT2443.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Vincent McFarlane

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane not in court.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received from Department of Corrections on this date and forwarded to Court for review.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Granting Request for Sentence Credit.  The Judgment in 14CF576 shall be amended to include a total of 253 days sentence credit, filed and signed by the Court.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
Defendant's request for sentence credit in 13CT002443 and 14CF000576.
Order amending JOC to reflect that defendant qualifies for WSAP after serving 1/2 of initial confinement signed and filed.

Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $2,400.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  

Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 24 months.
Court ordered ignition interlock, and any fees, for 24 months consecutive to revocation.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 42 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 0 days 
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*No contact with Coley J. (victim in 13CT2443).
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.

Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court grants defendant's request for substitution of attorney Lipscomb for attorney Polenz.  New counsel of record requests new plea date.  
  Plea hearing/sentencing scheduled for 10-20-2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court not in session 9-18-14, case rescheduled to 9-24-13, 8:30 am.  Notice of hearing sent to parties.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing. Case adjourned for a Projected Guilty Plea Hearing in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary P. Polenz in court, defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane not in court, in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  13CT2443 transferred to br 34 for global resolution.  Status conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary P. Polenz in court, defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in court with attorney Mary P Polenz.  Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in custody.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Step Nolten for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests, portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in court with Trisha Fritz who appears under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Michael Vincent McFarlane in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
